name: places/ChIJz3eOZb_srY0RAazbIGghaR4
formattedAddress: 41 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 41 E 11th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: They do not provide fast reimbursements. Actually, I'm not even sure if they reimburse at all. It's been 2 weeks since I submitted my claim of my very first and $1100+ vet bill. I believe most of us get pet insurance so our finances can be managed during most difficult times. I was so glad that I had insurance when my dog showed signs of illness, and I didn't hesitate to take her to the vet and get her on her meds. Turns out it may be better to just let her be sick because now I am stressed out due to claims not getting resolved and me having to stay up late and figure out how to make my finances round up. and maybe that says something about wagmo and their fake advertisements of "we reimburse within 24 hours" blah blah. They just want the $$$. If you go to their website Q&A section, they state that customers get reimbursed within 24 hours. But when you actually submit an insurance claim, they tell you only "wellness" plans get reimbursed within 24 hours. Now that's a word game. I hope they can make things right and not make people regret choosing them over other insurance companies.

originalText.text: I got an email from wagmo congratulating me on updating my plan. I was confused and checked because I didn't ask to update anything. I haven't made a claim and I have insured our dog since we got her at 8 weeks... she is two now. Well my update was just a 25% increase in rates!!! No notice or explanation. When questions they said rates are just going up due to costs....crazy. I am getting rid of it. It is almost $800 per year. I don't trust this company when they increase so much with no explanations... just a congrats?!?! No thanks. Time to find another insurance company or go without.

originalText.text: If you like to take your pet in to the vet and have everything done at once to reduce the stress on them, but have another issue pop up in the exam that needs to be checked out, forget about being reimbursed for any of the regular routine things on the invoice. They wouldn’t cover the exam which was a normal exam and routine bloodwork. If anything, this convinced me not to use their wellness plan. Like another poster said, this company is a scam. As  someone who works in the veterinary field, I strongly recommend looking into others.

originalText.text:
they never answer phone calls, bad service, no option to leave a voice mail, bad service , I will be cancelling my puppies health insurance

to continue, this insurance is too much, I have been to several dog insurance they are the worst ever having a penalty if you cancel while other pet insurances do not have, now I lost my credit card and requested a replacement, they can’t even wait !!! they email and say my account is past due, one thing I know though, with Healthy Paws which my other dog s insurance is, if payment fails , they suspend the coverage but they never mention past due,

If your insurer don’t want to pay, why would you force your clients to pay????? I am paying the $200 penalty just to get out but I still have my two dogs covered because of the extremely high penalty !  I left my other two dogs covered but I do not think they should charge a penalty if I decide to cancel  bcoz I never signed a contract with my dogs, I only signed a contract with one dog not realizing they have that clause!!!,

I would never recommend this insurance, I got traumatize with the penalty, but I am just paying it for them to shut up because they said, if I don’t pay the penalty, they ll bring me to COLLECTIONS so beware!!!!  so upsetting !!!
that is how they treat their clients!!!! WHAT A THING TO SAY!!!!

originalText.text: I’ve had Wagmo for 3 years at the rate of $65/month ($1800 in membership fee). I submitted a claim of $400 after 3 years and it was denied because it didn’t meet my deductible. Don’t waste your money. Just save the $65 in a separate bank account or hsa plan with your job. This is a scam like any other form of insurance in America
